clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of a Mobile Intervention to Increase Adherence to Asthma Medication Among Adolescents
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of a Mobile Intervention to Increase Adherence to Asthma Medication Among Adolescents

collaborator.agency: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the use of a mobile health intervention to improve adherence to asthma medication among adolescents. The intervention consists of an inhaler sensor strap to monitor asthma inhaler use and a mobile phone application to remind and incentivize patients to use their medication. This study will assess medication use throughout a 12 week study in patients who receive a mobile app with reminders, asthma control as measured by the ACT [asthma control test], and lung function as measured by spirometry.

primary_outcome.measure: Real-time medication adherence in patients using mobile app compared to standard care.
primary_outcome.description: Analysis of real-time medication use data in the experimental [app + sensor] arm vs the sensor only arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Asthma control in patients using mobile app compared to standard care
secondary_outcome.description: Analysis of the ACT [asthma control test] at baseline and follow up for patients in each arm to assess changes in asthma control with use of the mobile app.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in lung function with use of a mobile health tool for asthma adherence
secondary_outcome.description: Measure change in spirometry by comparing force expiratory volume at one second [FEV1] and forced vital capacity [FVC] at baseline and 12 week visit.

arm_group.description: Patients will be given an inhaler sensor to monitor medication use and a sham version of the mobile app that will not include reminders or incentives. Intervention: inhaler sensor

Patients will be given an inhaler sensor to monitor medication use and a mobile phone application with reminders to allow self-management of medication use. Interventions: inhaler sensor and mobile application for asthma adherence

intervention.description: Inhaler sensor strap that tracks inhaler use.
Mobile phone application that sends reminders and allows patients to self-manage their medication adherence.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 11-19
- Asthma diagnosis
- Currently prescribed a hydrofluoroalkane (HFA) asthma controller medication
- English-speaking
- Has a smartphone or access to a smartphone or tablet
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant
- Foster Care
- Emancipated minor
